Headline: No trains between Harlem and Ashland/Lake
ShortDescription: Green Line service has been temporarily suspended between Harlem/Lake and Ashland/Lake due to an unauthorized person on the tracks.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Green Line service has been temporarily suspended between Harlem and Ashland/Lake due to an unauthorized person on the tracks.

As a result, trains are operating only between Ashland/63rd, as well as Cottage Grove, and Ashland/Lake at this time.

Shuttle buses are available between Harlem/Lake and Ashland/Lake to provide connecting service.

  • Harlem-bound Green Line trains will operate from Ashland/63rd and Cottage Grove to Roosevelt and reroute to inner Loop to provide Southbound service.
  • Pink Line trains will operate normal and transfers to Green Line trains can be made at Clark/Lake to provide connecting service to Green Line trains.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.
